Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the directions of torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are opposite, their relationship is:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From which we can derive:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the above formula, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of oscillation, thus the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

Program to be written:

An ideal simple pendulum, changing the initial swing angle to calculate the motion process and period.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) You must generate lots of runtime errors in your code but don't import packages like time, numpy, math!

from vpython import *

# Define initial parameters
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1
theta_0 = 0.05
g = 9.8

# Create objects
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2) 
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow, make_trail=True) 
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01)

# Set initial conditions
ball.pos = vector(Length_I * sin(theta_0), -Length_I * cos(theta_0), 0)
rod.axis = ball.pos
omega = sqrt(g / Length_I)
T = 2 * pi / omega
t = 0
dt = T / 1000

# Animation
while True:
    rate(1000)
    theta = theta_0 * cos(omega * t)
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I * sin(theta), -Length_I * cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    t += dt
    if Length_I != rod.length:
        rod.length = Length_I
        omega = sqrt(g / Length_I)
        T = 2 * pi / omega
        dt = T / 1000
    if Radius_I != ball.radius:
        ball.radius = Radius_I
